title: 112_s2068
content: The Act may be cited as the "Access to Independent Health Insurance Advisors Act of 2012". Licensed independent insurance producers provide a wide range of services for individual consumers and businesses, including acquiring quotes, analyzing plan options, and consulting clients on health insurance purchases. They also offer guidance on benefit and contribution arrangements to ensure compliance with State and Federal laws, assist with tax savings, evaluate small business tax credits, and maximize tax advantages. Licensed independent insurance producers provide a wide range of services for individuals and businesses, including acquiring quotes, analyzing plan options, and consulting on health insurance purchases. They assist with tax savings, compliance with laws, and maximizing tax advantages. Producers also offer educational materials, on-site assistance, eligibility management, advocacy for employees, and advocacy for employers with insurers. Continuing education is required to maintain appropriate licenses and stay current with the insurance market. The National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) strongly advocates for the continuing role of licensed independent insurance producers in providing professional guidance to understand the significant changes in the regulatory environment for health plans, especially important for small businesses. The NAIC supports the role of insurance agents and brokers in assisting health insurance consumers during market changes. They urge Congress to amend MLR provisions to preserve consumer access to agents and brokers. It is crucial to recognize and protect the role of licensed independent insurance producers. SEC. 3. Protecting licensed independent insurance producers to serve the public. Amendment to Section 2718 of the Public Health Service Act to include remuneration for licensed independent insurance producers in the individual and small group market. Amendment to Section 2718 of the Public Health Service Act includes definitions for independent insurance producers and remuneration, specifying that remuneration does not include production bonuses. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will amend regulations within 60 days to implement amendments related to remuneration for independent insurance producers.
